item.title: RBZ Jewellers Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: RBZ Jewellers Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This development reflects a deterioration in the stock’s momentum and raises concerns about its medium to long-term outlook amid ongoing sector challenges. Time: 14 minutes ago

item.title: Mixed Earnings Momentum as 650 Companies Report Dec-2025 Quarterly Results
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has delivered a mixed bag of results with exactly half of the 650 companies declaring their numbers reporting positive outcomes. While mid and small caps continue to outperform large caps in terms of profitability, sectoral leaders and micro-cap performers have also emerged, signalling nuanced trends across the market. Time: 15 minutes ago

item.title: Oil India Ltd. Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Oil India Ltd. has recently formed a Golden Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) has crossed above the 200-day moving average. This development suggests a potential bullish breakout and a shift in long-term momentum for the mid-cap oil company, which has outperformed the Sensex over multiple time frames. Time: 15 minutes ago

item.title: Summit Securities Q3 FY26: Profit Plunges 81% Despite Strong Nine-Month Performance
item.description: Summit Securities Ltd., a non-banking financial company specialising in investments in shares and securities, reported a sharp sequential decline in its third-quarter results for FY2026, with net profit plummeting 81.23% quarter-on-quarter to ₹17.02 crores from ₹90.66 crores in Q2 FY26. The dramatic drop follows an exceptional second quarter that saw profits surge 349.03%. Despite the quarterly setback, the company's nine-month performance remains robust, with year-on-year growth metrics showing significant improvement. The stock, currently trading at ₹1,739.00 with a market capitalisation of ₹1,864 crores, has declined 10.60% year-to-date as investors digest the volatile quarterly performance. Time: 43 minutes ago

item.title: Coromandel International Q3 FY26: Sequential Profit Decline Amid Volume Pressures
item.description: Coromandel International Ltd., India's largest fertiliser company by market capitalisation, reported a consolidated net profit of ₹505.88 crores for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), marking a marginal decline of 1.15% year-on-year and a sharp 37.18% drop quarter-on-quarter. The ₹66,530-crore company faced sequential headwinds despite posting robust revenue growth of 26.59% YoY to ₹8,779.45 crores, reflecting the cyclical nature of the fertiliser business and seasonal volume fluctuations. Time: 44 minutes ago
